body_html: Also, on Windows, our current recommendation is to build static libraries and link it to your binary. Using dllexport sparsely would be a bit hard to manage, and we are yet to figure out a way to define which functions need to be exported and which do not. For now, static lib might be the best path.
body_text: Also, on Windows, our current recommendation is to build static libraries and link it to your binary. Using dllexport sparsely would be a bit hard to manage, and we are yet to figure out a way to define which functions need to be exported and which do not. For now, static lib might be the best path.
body: Also, on Windows, our current recommendation is to build static libraries and link it to your binary. Using dllexport sparsely would be a bit hard to manage, and we are yet to figure out a way to define which functions need to be exported and which do not. For now, static lib might be the best path.
